citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC):
-The PVC states to administer Rabies vaccinations for animals added to the facility within 90 days of acquiring that
animal. Adult dogs #4485, #4483, #9753, #9769, #9784, #9394, #9756 did not receive a Rabies Vaccination within 90
days of the facility acquiring the animal.
-The PVC states to administer Parvovirus, Distemper, Hepatitis, and Leptospirosis vaccinations at 9, 12, and 15 weeks of
age. The following adult dogs did not receive one or more of these vaccinations: #9756, #9753, #9769, and #9394.
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule may result in animals to not be
adequately protected against disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in
accordance with the schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to review
records and create a plan to determine when to administer future vaccinations for these animals.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by March 6, 2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC):  
 
-The PVC states to administer Rabies vaccinations for animals added to the facility within 90 days of acquiring that 
animal. Adult dogs #4485, #4483, #9753, #9769, #9784, #9394, #9756 did not receive a Rabies Vaccination within 90 
days of the facility acquiring the animal. 
-The PVC states to administer Parvovirus, Distemper, Hepatitis, and Leptospirosis vaccinations at 9, 12, and 15 weeks of 
age. The following adult dogs did not receive one or more of these vaccinations: #9756, #9753, #9769, and #9394. 
 
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule may result in animals to not be 
adequately protected against disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in 
accordance with the schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to review 
records and create a plan to determine when to administer future vaccinations for these animals. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by March 6, 2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
